page.title: 01AN T'ATH LEATHANN-BROADFORD
page.content: {Broadford----------An t'Ath Leathan.} Sheltered by the mighty bulk of{Beinn {na Caillich}Broadford lies twenty-five miles from Portree,eight from Kyleakin and fifteen from Ardvasar it sits by the quiet waters of Broadford Bay in the lee of the mainland and the islands of Scalpay,Pabay,Longay and Crowlin providing a natural refuge and abundance of prawn,scampi,& crabs for the inshore fishermen.{Broadford }is really an amalgam of 7 small villages, Ashaig,Breakish,Skulamus,Waterloo,Harr apool,Corry and Broadford itself.A small but steadily growing population derives a living mainly from the tourist industry in summer with small scale{crofting}to supplement the income.However,recent developments at Kishorn and the growth of light industry locally has slowed down the erosion of population greatly.
